channel.title: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
channel.description:
I am using Kicksecure 17 as a template for sys-net in Qubes OS on multiple laptops.
One of the laptops has an Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi adapter, but the iwlwifi drivers do not recognize this WiFi hardware.
I’ve researched this issue on other Linux distributions, and the common solution is to install the `backport-iwlwifi-dkms` package. However, this package is not available in the repositories currently configured in the Kicksecure template.
Can anyone suggest how to resolve this issue?
Although this response in another post is really discouraging, so I am not sure if I'll receive any help here or not.
https://forums.kicksecure.com/t/kicksecure-for-sys-qubes-and-sys-vpn/442/2

item.title: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
item.dc:creator: marcos-morar43
item.description:
Sorry, I didn’t upgrade the wifi firmware after installing the linux kernel from bookworm-backports. Now that I’ve upgraded the firmware, the card is working fine.

Thanks a lot.

Read full topic
item.source: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template

item.title: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
item.dc:creator: marcos-morar43
item.description:
arraybolt3:

You might be able to install a Linux kernel from bookworm-backports to get the card working.

I tried that, but it didn’t resolve the issue.

Patrick:

Can you make it work on Debian?

The card works fine on Fedora, Arch Linux, Ubuntu, and Mint, but not on Debian or Debian-based Kicksecure. Ubuntu has the package, but I have no idea how to manually install it on Debian.

Read full topic

item.title: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
marcos-morar43:

backport-iwlwifi-dkms

Might not be in Debian:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=929692

Manual installation might be possible.

Can you make it work on Debian?

As per:

Kicksecure – 6 Sep 24

Potential Solutions Beyond Kicksecure!

Explore resources outside of Kicksecure to address unspecific questions or issues.

Kicksecure – 18 May 25

Self Support First Policy for Kicksecure

Definition of the Self Support First Policy for Kicksecure

Read full topic
item.source: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template

item.title: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
item.dc:creator: marcos-morar43
item.description:
I am using Kicksecure 17 as a template for sys-net in Qubes OS on multiple laptops.

One of the laptops has an Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi adapter, but the iwlwifi drivers do not recognize this WiFi hardware.

I’ve researched this issue on other Linux distributions, and the common solution is to install the backport-iwlwifi-dkms package. However, this package is not available in the repositories currently configured in the Kicksecure template.

Can anyone suggest how to resolve this issue?

Although this response in another post is really discouraging, so I am not sure if I’ll receive any help here or not.

Kicksecure for sys qubes and sys-vpn? Qubes
Just overload of support requests. sys-usb, sys-net are difficult enough to use in Qubes without Kicksecure being involved. I don’t want anyone’s sys-usb, sys-net issues caused by Qubes being blamed on Kicksecure and reported here. No time to investigate such issues. That’s all. If it works, then great. Thank you for your interest!

Read full topic
item.source: No Drivers for Intel Alder Lake-P PCH CNVi WiFi in Kicksecure Template
